Posts.Content: Saitong, I have not any experience with North Side other than my 3yo was born there great hospital. I was treated at St. Joseph's under Dr. Sanda. I can't say enough about how pleased I have been. Follow up is next week I had surgery never considered radiation.
Posts.Signature: 1/1959 =56yo 10-15-2015 PSA 5.7, No symptoms...incidental blood work. 10-20-2015 DRE negative 11-4-2015 2nd DRE normal 11-17-2015 Biopsy 11-19-2015 Prostrate Cancer Diagnosis, Gleason 4+3=7 8 of 12 90% left 70% right. 12/16/2015 surgery consult with St. Joseph's Urology director Dr. Sanda 12/29/2015 Robotic DaVinicci.. post surgery Dr. Sanda said he removed prostrate saving both nerve bundles with good margins and lymph nodes. Discharged the next day 12/302015 at 3pm. 1/6/2016: 8 day follow up catheter out! Post lab report 25% total involvement, 4+3=7, negative findings in lymph nodes, negative margins except for the anterior which showed positive section. Looking forward to a clean blood test March 6th.

Posts.Title: DRE Found Nodule on My Prostate

Posts.Content: Tom, Firstly, welcome here albeit it is a place none of us wanted to arrive; but the reality will eventually set in you are here. Don't panic you have a very curable case from what I see. My suggestion is surgery as it provided the greatest number of options. Having been just diagnosed and had surgery days ago- I wouldn't do it any other way. The biggest factor to consider is the surgeon and facility. You are on the right path.

Posts.Title: Diagnosed Recently

Posts.Content: Hi, I just got my biopsy results back. Looks like I am in the cancer club now. I was fortunate enough to be friends with RonDef already so he has been a godsend. I've been trying to get up to speed on all this reading your posts. I am also try to be positive about extending my life even if it looks like loosing that pesky prostate gland. From what I know now it looks like my choice is the robotic Divinci. I just got the phone call Thursday and my sit down with the urologist I have now is on 12/5. So, in the mean time I'm trying to get an appointment with Dr. Pattaras from Emory. Does anyone have any experience with him. The doctor I am seeing now is from Rome, Dr. Gilbert I don't even know if he does the Di Vinnci as of yet. I can't help right now much as I am just thrown into this, but I will do anything I can to help anyone of you guys. As I am a disabled veteran I thought I was through health challenges but looks like it continues. However, I am up to the next chapter and many more. Thanks for your support and this forum. David

Posts.Content: Hi, I just got my biopsy results back. Looks like I am in the cancer club now. I was fortunate enough to be friends with RonDef already so he has been a godsend. I've been trying to get up to speed on all this reading your posts. I am also try to be positive about extending my life even if it looks like loosing that pesky prostate gland. From what I know now it looks like my choice is the robotic Divinci. I just got the phone call Thursday and my sit down with the urologist I have now is on 12/5. So, in the mean time I'm trying to get an appointment with Dr. Pattaras from Emory. Does anyone have any experience with him. The doctor I am seeing now is from Rome, Dr. Gilbert I don't even know if he does the Di Vinnci as of yet. I can't help right now much as I am just thrown into this, but I will do anything I can to help anyone of you guys. As I am a disabled veteran I thought I was through health challenges but looks like it continues. However, I am up to the next chapter and many more. Thanks for your support and this forum. David

Posts.Title: First post op PSA

Posts.Content: sounds like all good news.
Posts.Signature: 1/1959 =56yo 10-15-2015 PSA 5.7, No symptoms...incidental blood work. 10-20-2015 DRE negative 11-4-2015 2nd DRE normal 11-17-2015 Biopsy 11-19-2015 Prostrate Cancer Diagnosis, Gleason 4+3=7 8 of 12 90% left 70% right. 12/16/2015 surgery consult with St. Joseph's Urology director Dr. Sanda 12/29/2015 Robotic DaVinicci.. post surgery Dr. Sanda said he removed prostrate saving both nerve bundles with good margins and lymph nodes. Discharged the next day 12/302015 at 3pm. 1/6/2016: 8 day follow up catheter out! Post lab report 25% total involvement, 4+3=7, negative findings in lymph nodes, negative margins except for the anterior which showed positive section. Looking forward to a clean blood test March 6th.
